Miscellaneous enhancements

 

Several other enhancements have also been implemented and these are detailed below:

 

Source Pane previous files menu

The context menu for the Source pane now contains a sub-menu displaying a list of the previous 10 files that were loaded. Clicking on one of the menu items will load the file into the existing pane. The pane splitting keys (described in the Drag & Drop documentation) may also be used to split the pane horizontally or vertically upon loading.

This menu may also be accessed using a user-configurable keyboard accelerator (default of Ctrl + P)

When a new file is loaded, the previous file is added to the top of the list and the other items are shuffled down the list (if there are more than 10 items, the last entry drops off the list). If the file being added to the menu is already in the list, it is simply shuffled to the top.

The file list is saved to the configuration file (e.g. DBUGPS2.PS2) & is reloaded at start-up.

 

 

Open header file from context menu in Source pane

When right-clicking in the source pane over the name of a header file (text surrounded by “ “ or < > markers), this will add an additional item Open “name” to the context menu. When selected, this will open the file in the source pane (as long as the file is located within the source search path).
